snippet: More than a year after the death of their director, the Fine Arts Museums of San Francisco endure staff departures and complaints about the board president.
abstract: Fine Arts Museums of San Francisco are in turmoil more than a year after the death of their last director, as longtime staff members are ousted and unhappy employees leak internal e-mails to embarrass management; many insiders blame board president Diane B Wilsey for creating problems, saying that she has accumulated too much influence within the institutions.
lead_paragraph: More than a year after the death of their director, the Fine Arts Museums of San Francisco endure staff departures and complaints about the board president.
